snippet: Samuel J. Palmisano, who is departing as I.B.M.’s chief executive, devised four questions that pushed his huge company to stay a step ahead of its rivals.
abstract: Samuel J. Palmisano, who is departing as IBM’s chief executive, has, during his tenure, created a framework that pushed the company to stay a step ahead of its rivals; company shed multibillion-dollar businesses, chose higher profit margins over corporate size, and expanded aggressively overseas, seeking sales, low-cost engineering talent and quicker organizational reflexes.
lead_paragraph: Samuel J. Palmisano, who is departing as I.B.M.’s chief executive, devised four questions that pushed his huge company to stay a step ahead of its rivals.
